metadata.Title: CVE-2013-0169 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The TLS protocol 1.1 and 1.2 and the DTLS protocol 1.0 and 1.2, as used inOpenSSL, OpenJDK, PolarSSL, and other products, do not properly considertiming side-channel attacks on a MAC check requirement during theprocessing of malformed CBC padding, which allows remote attackers toconduct distinguishing attacks and plaintext-recovery attacks viastatistical analysis of timing data for crafted packets, aka the "LuckyThirteen" issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-0169` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1c-4ubuntu8
openssl - 1.0.1c-4ubuntu8
No subscription required

libssl0.9.8 - 0.9.8o-7ubuntu3.2.14.04.1
No subscription required

icedtea-6-jre-cacao - 6b27-1.12.3-1ubuntu1
icedtea-6-jre-jamvm - 6b27-1.12.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-demo - 6b27-1.12.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-jdk - 6b27-1.12.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-jre - 6b27-1.12.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-jre-headless - 6b27-1.12.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-jre-lib - 6b27-1.12.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-jre-zero - 6b27-1.12.3-1ubuntu1
openjdk-6-source - 6b27-1.12.3-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

icedtea-7-jre-jamvm - 7u15-2.3.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-demo - 7u15-2.3.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-jdk - 7u15-2.3.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-jre - 7u15-2.3.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-jre-headless - 7u15-2.3.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-jre-lib - 7u15-2.3.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-jre-zero - 7u15-2.3.7-1ubuntu1
openjdk-7-source - 7u15-2.3.7-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1c-4ubuntu8').
openssl098 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.8o-7ubuntu3.2.14.04.1').
openjdk-6 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6b27-1.12.3-1ubuntu1').
openjdk-7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7u15-2.3.7-1ubuntu1').
